group_1.textLeft: Okay. So. My mom's the whole reason I love @all things kawaii.

group_1.textRight: Oh, so she likes cute stuff too.

group_1.textLeft: Yeah, she's a big fan of Japanese kawaii@culture.
Whenever she went to Japan for work, she'd@always bring me back the best presents.

group_1.textRight: Wait, she came to Japan a lot for work?

group_1.textLeft: Well...sometimes. When she had to do press@for her movies.
My mom's in a lot of movies.
Yep.
My parents met on a movie set where my dad@was the director.
Yeah. My mom and dad do what they love.
When I see them at work, they're just so full@of life. They're really amazing.
And thanks to them, I've gotten to do all@kinds of stuff too.
Dad took me along to a bunch of different@cities and countries.
And I've gone on trips with my friends to@places inside the U.S.

group_1.textRight: It sounds really fun. I could never do that.
I just know my mom and dad would worry@too much.

group_1.textLeft: Yeah... I made my parents worry a lot, too.
But they've always helped me...
They want me to be able to pursue the things@I want to do.

group_1.textRight: Oh, so does that mean they supported you@when you said you wanted to study here?

group_1.textLeft: No... They were against me studying abroad.

group_1.narration: Why can't I study abroad in Japan?
Daddy! Tell me why I can't!

group_1.textCenter: I just can't approve of it.
It's still too soon for you to go to a@foreign country alone.

group_1.narration: That can't be the only reason!@What is it, really?

group_1.textLeft: There'd been lots of times where they were@opposed to what I wanted to do.
But each time they'd explained their@reasoning.
This was the first time they hadn't...
Which is why I just couldn't accept it.
Ever since I was your age, Riko, becoming@a student in Japan was my dream.
I couldn't just give up on it...

group_1.textRight: Did you leave for Japan on bad terms with@them, then?

group_1.textLeft: No...
I got their permission...
Kyubey showed up.
